name: A. Direction Change
statement:
You are given a grid with n rows and m columns. Rows and columns are
numbered from 1 to n, and from 1 to m. The intersection of the a-th row
and b-th column is denoted by (a, b). Initially, you are standing in the
top left corner (1, 1). Your goal is to reach the bottom right corner
(n, m).You can move in four directions from (a, b): up to (a-1, b), down
to (a+1, b), left to (a, b-1) or right to (a, b+1).You cannot move in
the same direction in two consecutive moves, and you cannot leave the
grid. What is the minimum number of moves to reach (n, m)?
